body_html:
So I tried x86 options of gcc as @gunan suggested. Thank you very much.

But I still get trouble to compile TF on 32-bit machine. Sorry about that. Maybe it's time for me to let the old laptop go. However, I tracked down the matter just a little bit more to make things clear.

Below is the error message emitted from bazel:

ERROR: /home/sungjin/.usr/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/factorization/BUILD:
115:1: Executing genrule //tensorflow/contrib/factorization:gen_clustering_ops_p
ygenrule failed (Aborted): bash failed: error executing command /bin/bash -c ...
 (remaining 1 argument(s) skipped).
2018-02-02 01:05:41.993519: F tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:36] 
The TensorFlow library was compiled to use SSE instructions, but these aren't av
ailable on your machine.
/bin/bash: line 1: 29481 Aborted                 bazel-out/host/bin/tensorflow/c
ontrib/factorization/gen_gen_clustering_ops_py_wrappers_cc , '' 0 0 > bazel-out/
local-py3-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/contrib/factorization/python/ops/gen_clusterin
g_ops.py
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build

and the command I gave is:

bazel build --config=opt --linkopt='-lrt' --copt=-march=i686 --cxxopt=-march=i68
6 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

As far as I know, -march=i686 do not turn on __SSE__ flag, and I'm curious about what turns on SSE, said as above.

Thank you for your kind help.

body:
So I tried x86 options of gcc as @gunan suggested. Thank you very much.

But I still get trouble to compile TF on 32-bit machine. Sorry about that. Maybe it's time for me to let the old laptop go. However, I tracked down the matter just a little bit more to make things clear.

Below is the error message emitted from bazel:

```
ERROR: /home/sungjin/.usr/src/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/factorization/BUILD:
115:1: Executing genrule //tensorflow/contrib/factorization:gen_clustering_ops_p
ygenrule failed (Aborted): bash failed: error executing command /bin/bash -c ...
 (remaining 1 argument(s) skipped).
2018-02-02 01:05:41.993519: F tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:36] 
The TensorFlow library was compiled to use SSE instructions, but these aren't av
ailable on your machine.
/bin/bash: line 1: 29481 Aborted                 bazel-out/host/bin/tensorflow/c
ontrib/factorization/gen_gen_clustering_ops_py_wrappers_cc , '' 0 0 > bazel-out/
local-py3-opt/genfiles/tensorflow/contrib/factorization/python/ops/gen_clusterin
g_ops.py
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
```

and the command I gave is:

```
bazel build --config=opt --linkopt='-lrt' --copt=-march=i686 --cxxopt=-march=i68
6 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```

As far as I know, `-march=i686` do not turn on `__SSE__` flag, and I'm curious about what turns on  SSE, said as above.

Thank you for your kind help.
